scenes.goal: Introduce recursion as a problem-solving technique
visual_elements: Simple diagram: A large box labeled 'Problem' pointing to a smaller identical box labeled 'Subproblem'
scenes.narrative_intent: Define recursion as solving a problem by solving smaller instances of the same problem.

scenes.goal: Show the two essential parts of a recursive function
visual_elements: Highlight: Base case condition and return statement
scenes.narrative_intent: Explain the base case (stopping condition) and the recursive step (reducing the problem size).

scenes.goal: Visualize the call stack for factorial(3)
visual_elements: Stack diagram: Boxes labeled 'factorial(3)', 'factorial(2)', 'factorial(1)' stacked vertically
Arrows showing push and pop operations
scenes.narrative_intent: Demonstrate how recursive calls build up and then unwind via the call stack.

scenes.goal: Trace the computation and return values
visual_elements: Flowchart: Start -> factorial(3) -> factorial(2) -> factorial(1) -> base case returns 1
Annotated arrows: Multiply results as the stack unwinds (1*2*6)
scenes.narrative_intent: Show step-by-step evaluation and how values propagate back to the original call.

visual_elements: Side-by-side panels: Recursive factorial vs iterative loop factorial
Table: Lines of code, readability, stack usage
scenes.narrative_intent: Highlight trade-offs: clarity vs performance and stack depth considerations.

visual_elements: Warning icon: Missing base case leading to infinite recursion
Diagram: Deep recursion causing stack overflow
Checklist: Define base case, ensure progress, consider tail recursion
scenes.narrative_intent: Emphasize correctness, termination, and limits of recursion in practice.
